1.words: Okay, so really going over once again, reiterating the purpose of the conversation. Really just building constructive listening space. So really want you to share from your personal stories. So think about your own lives, your own experiences, rather than maybe something you heard, or rather just your own position. It's really just more about build off of your experience, right? So stick to your story, your truth. Then I also want, again, to reiterate what's going to happen to this recording. So after this meeting, after this conversation, I'm going to upload the audio recording to a database called Fora, which MIT uses to create a transcript. So the MIT Center for Constructive Communication, I'm going to refer to it as CCC if you get confused, and so they go ahead and go in, look at the data and everything. It's really an effort to create a conversation platform. The Fora system creates the transcript of every recorded conversation, uses highlight keywords, and then allows also us to search the conversation, listen to audio snippets and discover patterns. Really what we want to accomplish today is to begin the process of weaving a virtual tapestry of conversations across the city. As a participant in this conversation, you are providing consent to the MIT Center for Constructive Communication to retain the recording of this conversation in accordance with the mission of the Real Talk at Boston team in transforming Boston into a listening city. You also understand that the conversation will be part of the Real Talk at Boston Public Conversation Collection with the goal to foster constructive conversations across the city. CCC will collect, retain, and analyze these conversations in keeping with that goal and with the mission to develop methods and tools that foster constructive communication in local communities. Participation in this conversation is voluntary and you can withdraw any time without consequences. Sessions will be recorded, but you can opt out and have this recording deleted. Only the research team at the MIT CCC will have access to your data. Your identity will be protected, and information won't be shared without permission unless required by law. There are minimal foreseen risk. However, as with any conversation, there is a chance that you will hear stories that elicit strong emotions. We will support you in hosting a safe conversation where you only share what you feel comfortable sharing. And then do you consent to this? And if everyone can just say, I agree.

And then do you consent to this? And if everyone can just say, I agree.

5.words: Perfect. Okay. So I want to make sure everyone gets a chance to share and learn from this conversation. To support this, we'll have a couple of guidelines. Speak for yourself out of your own experiences, not your opinions. Allow others to speak for themselves. Share the time, allow others to finish talking. Take turns, stay curious, ask honest questions. Pause, take time for reflection. Listen generously. Assume good intentions while recognizing that your words have impact. Do all those guidelines make sense?

35.words: I'd say, when I asked to be in DCF, it was around 2018. The living situation wasn't going well and it was a lot of ups and downs and everything. And so I felt like I was advocating for myself in the right way when everything started going in the right direction. After I communicated  with my doctor and everybody else I communicated with. 47.words: For me, I just feel like before I turned 18, DCF should have had the resources that I needed to work with, meaning money-wise, and managing it and everything. And then wait until I turn 18 and then a few months later, then when my school starts taking place, then they want to start. You know what I mean? It's not fair that I have to, yeah, I should be learning money management on my own, but I should have the resources, if DCF said that they were going to provide. And also food networks and stuff like that. Right now, it's not too bad with me, but when I go grocery shopping, it's like I go for the whole month, so I can't even go to the grocery store without putting half of my stuff back in the cart.
